name: Oldies: Dressing Up Trivia Game | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Elton John.

	"Benny and the Jets". "She's got electric boots,, a mohair suit ..."

Simon and Garfunkel.

	"America". "She said the man in the gabardine suit was a spy".

Bobby Vinton.

	The song of the same name. "She wore blue velvet ..." Something of a "signature song" for him.

Elvis Presley.

	Song of same title. Early Elvis.

Dodie Stevens.

	"Tan Shoes and Pink Shoelaces".. "A polka dot vest and man-oh-man ...""Cute" song from the 50's.

questions.text: "Itsy bitsy teenie weenie yellow polka dot bikini"
questions.explanation:
Brian Hyland.

	Song of the same name. Another "cute" song from the 50's.

Bobby Darin.

	"Mack the Knife". "Fancy gloves, though, wears old Mack Heath, ..."

Del Shannon.

	Song of the same name. His "other" hit (aside from "Runaway").

Nancy Sinatra.

	Song of the same name. Her biggest hit. (Her only solo hit?)

questions.text: "Feeling near as faded as my jeans"
questions.explanation:
Janis Joplin.

	"Bobby McGee". "Busted flat in Baton Rouge, waitin' for a train ..."One of her best and best-known songs.
